abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Power Plant
            Efficiency Improvement Project for Pakistan was
            satisfactory. The project achieved its main objectives, its
            impact on institutional development was partially
            successful, sustainability is likely, and both the Bank and
            Borrower performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, WAPDA should strengthen
            its systems for supervision of all its ongoing projects to
            avoid delays and get timely feedback for taking remedial
            actions. Second, changes in original design make it
            difficult to evaluate the project outcome compared to the
            appraisal estimates, both in terms of costs as well as the
            specific benefits (capacity recovery, efficiency
            improvements, etc.) to be achieved. Finally, in the future,
            WAPDA should ensure that progress on institution-building
            activities takes place along with physical work. Also, any
            deficiencies or delays on this count should be taken up with
            senior management at an early stage.
